body_content.explanation: the treatment of injuries or diseases in people or animals by cutting open the body and removing or repairing the damaged part:
examples: The patient had/underwent surgery on his heart.
He made a good recovery after surgery to remove a brain tumour.

body_content.explanation: an occasion when a medical operation involving cutting open the body is performed on someone :
examples: He has had three surgeries on his wrist in the past two years.

body_content.explanation: a place where you can go to ask advice from or receive treatment from a doctor or dentist:
examples: If you come to the surgery at 10.30, the doctor will see you then.
On Saturday mornings, surgery (= the period of opening of the place where you can go to see your doctor) is from 9.00 to 12.00.

body_content.explanation: the regular period of time when a person can visit their Member of Parliament to ask advice:
examples: Our MP holds a weekly surgery on Friday mornings.
